topic.bridgehead: udev-based network interface names mixed with traditional names

listitem.para: There is no usable information provided by the kernel to udev. Therefore, udev cannot figure out a device name.
The information provided to udev is not suitable, such as non-unique device IDs.

topic.para: The solution is to create custom naming udev rules for the devices that are not properly named by the udev rules that are currently in use. Inspect files in the /etc/udev/rules.d directory, for example, 70-persistent-net.rules.
